chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody and with Attorney Martinez.  This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes. in 15CF27 and 14CF94.
Plea hearing at 10-26-2015 10:30 am
Status conference at 09-28-2015 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Martinez.  Defendant does not want to proceed today.  Attorney Martinez moves to withdraw as counsel.  Court asks defendant if he concurs.  He does.  Attorney Martinez will contact SPD.  Court reserves ruling on the motion to withdraw to see if SPD will appoint successor counsel.
Plea hearing at 09-09-2015 10:30 am
Status conference at 07-13-2015 03:00 pm
Status conference at 06-29-2015 03:00 pm
And Notice of Witness List
Status conference at 06-15-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel Andrew Martinez.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Waiver of right to preliminary hearing on 15CF5, 15CF11, and 15CF27.  All cases set for status on 6-15-15 at 3:00.

Bond covers the following cases:  14CF94, 14CF152, 15CF5, 15CF11 and 15CF27.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  H.N.L., John Cook; Minor Z. A. & Zachary K.   Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court you shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference at 05-15-2015 02:30 pm
Preliminary hearing cancelled per request of Tanya Deerpalsing
Preliminary hearing at 04-29-2015 11:15 am
Status conference at 04-29-2015 11:00 am
Withdrawal of Counsel

Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel Erika Bahnson present in courtroom.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Bahnson motions the Court to allow her to withdraw due to breakdown of client/counsel relationship.  She states she will drop her files off at the SPDO after court this morning.  Defendant had demanded his preliminary hearing be held within the time limits.  Court makes a finding that there is good cause to go beyond the time limits as the SPDO will need to re-appoint new counsel.  Will continue day to day until new counsel is appointed.  DA Fox states that the main investigating officer will not be available from April 7 -11.  Defendant remanded to Jackson County Jail.

Defendant appeared by VTC from Jackson County Jail with attorney Erika Bahnson present in courtroom.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Intitial appearance held on 15CF5 and 15CF11.  Waived reading of complaints and attorney Bahnson states they have discussed waiving right to preliminary hearing and he is waiving the time limits.  Court questions defendant on right to preliminary hearing.  He wishes to waive time limits and Court accepts that wavier.  Defense requests pretrial and status dates.  15CF5 and 15CF11 were set for pretrial and status.  All pending cases will track together.  14CF94 & 14CF152 set for status on 3-2-15 at 3:00.  Cash bond reduced with same conditions as previously ordered.

Status conference at 02-16-2015 03:00 pm
to Judge from DA Fox.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared late.  Attorney Bahnson appeared by telephone.  Discussion with Judge on proposed disposition of the case.  Court not willing to stay a 15 year sentence.  Parties will discuss alternatives, and inform the court.  STC set for 2/16/15

These bond conditions are for cases 14CF152 and 14CF94:  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: co defendant John Cook; Minor Z. A. and Victim Zachary K..  Until further order of the court you shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
